content: Honestly, this place is a total rip-off. R350 for a main course that was tiny! The portion sizes are laughable for the prices they charge. Not worth the money at all. Won't be back.
title: Overpriced and underwhelming
author: Budget Diner

content: Beautiful setting but extremely expensive for what you get. The wine markup is ridiculous - 4x retail! Makes it hard to enjoy when you feel like you're being taken advantage of.
title: Too expensive for the quality
author: Wine Enthusiast

content: The food was okay but not worth the premium prices. R280 for pasta that I could make better at home. Stellenbosch has so many better value options. Disappointing.
title: Poor value for money
author: Local Foodie

content: Nice atmosphere but the bill was shocking. Two mains, one starter, and two drinks came to over R900. For that price, I expected much more. The portions were small too.
title: Wallet shock
author: Cape Town Couple

content: We used to come here regularly but the prices have gone up while quality went down. R85 for a basic salad? R45 for a soft drink? It's just not worth it anymore sadly.
title: Prices have gotten out of hand
author: Former Regular

content: Terrible value. The 'gourmet' burger was R195 and came with barely any chips. Other restaurants offer twice the food for half the price. Management needs to rethink their pricing.
title: Daylight robbery
author: Hungry Customer

content: Such a shame because the location is gorgeous, but they're charging Cape Town Waterfront prices for average food. There are much better deals in the area. Skip this one.
title: Location premium gone too far
author: Tourist

content: What a fantastic surprise! The lunch special is incredible value - R145 for a two-course meal with coffee. Quality ingredients too. Best value in Stellenbosch right now!
title: Amazing lunch special
author: Happy Customer

content: Finally, a restaurant that doesn't overcharge! Fair prices for generous portions. The R175 roast of the day was huge and delicious. This is how restaurants should price their food.
title: Fair pricing refreshing
author: Value Seeker

content: Great value for the Stellenbosch area. The set menu at R225 for 3 courses is a steal. Wine pairings are also reasonably priced. You get what you pay for and then some!
title: Excellent value set menu
author: Wine Tourist

content: Pleasantly surprised by the prices! Not cheap, but absolutely fair for the quality and portions. Left feeling satisfied that we got good value. The kids' menu is also well-priced.
title: Worth every rand
author: Family of Four

content: The early bird special (5-6pm) offers 20% off - makes this place very affordable. Had an excellent steak dinner for under R200 including sides. Clever promotion!
title: Early bird is the way
author: Smart Diner

content: They've really improved their value proposition. New menu has better prices and bigger portions than before. The R155 pasta special is generous and tasty. Much better now!
title: Much improved value
author: Return Visitor

content: Finally a Stellenbosch spot where you don't feel ripped off! Prices match the quality perfectly. The wine list has options at every price point. Felt fair and enjoyable.
title: No more tourist trap
author: International Visitor

content: Recommended by locals as the best value in the area and they were right! Huge portions, fair prices, friendly service. Why can't more restaurants be like this?
title: Best value in Stellenbosch
author: Johannesburg Visitor
